question: Which of the following lists species that are not necessarily now threatened with extinction but that may become so unless trade is closely controlled?
explanation: Appendix II of CITESÂ  Includes species that although currently not threatened with extinction, may become so without trade controls. Most of the CITES species are listed in this Appendix, including American ginseng, paddlefish, lions, American alligators, mahogany, and many corals.
